Description: Deep ploughing followed by harrowing to achieve a fine tilth. Incorporate organic matter if needed. Ensure proper drainage.
Drill sowing is recommended. Maintain a row spacing of 22.5 cm. Seed rate: 100-120 kg/ha. Seed treatment with fungicides is crucial.
Critical irrigation stages: Crown root initiation (CRI) – 20-25 days after sowing; Tillering; Late jointing; Flowering; Dough stage. Provide irrigation based on rainfall and soil moisture.
Apply basal dose of Nitrogen:Phosphorus:Potassium (NPK) as per soil test recommendations. Generally, 120:60:40 kg/ha is recommended. Apply N in splits – basal, after CRI and at flowering.
Manual weeding or chemical weed control using herbicides like Isoproturon or Clodinafop. First weeding should be done 30-35 days after sowing.

Monitor for aphids, stem borer, and brown rust. Use appropriate insecticides/fungicides based on infestation level and recommendations from agricultural experts. Seed treatment helps with initial pest and disease control.
Harvest when the grains are hard and the straw turns golden yellow. Moisture content should be around 20-25%. Threshing should be done after proper drying.
